Instruction: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Coat a 10-inch Bundt or tube pan with butter and flour.
Scatter pecans evenly across the greased and floured pan; leave it aside. In a separate bowl, sift together the flour, salt, and baking soda; set aside.

Cream butter and sugar together in a mixing bowl until light and fluffy. Add the eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Stir in the vanilla extract. Alternate adding the dry ingredients with the sour cream until well combined. Pour the batter into the prepared pan.

Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 75 to 90 minutes. Cool the cake on a wire rack for 20 minutes, then tap the pan firmly a few times and shake gently to loosen the cake. Invert the cake onto a wire rack, allowing it to cool completely before serving.
Drizzle confectioners' sugar mixture over the warm cake before slicing and serving.
